      • getAllLoggedTransactionsFromAccount

        public static java.util.List<LoggedTransaction> getAllLoggedTransactionsFromAccount(java.lang.String accountNumber)
        If you want to retrieve all the transactions a user have, you can use this method...
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - specifies which account.
        Returns:
        a list with LoggedTransaction-objects

      • sortTransactions

        public static java.util.List<LoggedTransaction> sortTransactions(java.util.List<LoggedTransaction> transactions)
        This sorting-method sorts the list based on the timestamp(long). It places the largest long(the latest timestamp) in the first place of the list and the latest logged transaction in the last index in the list. This method compares all the objects in the list and sorts them based on a if-statement("bruteforce"-sorting). This could be replaced with the quicksort-algorithm for better performance.
        Parameters:
        transactions - is the list with LoggedTransaction-objects that is getting sorted.
        Returns:

      • logTransfer

        public static boolean logTransfer(java.lang.String accountNumber,
                                  java.lang.String accountNumber2,
                                  java.math.BigInteger kroner,
                                  int oere,
                                  java.lang.String message)
        This method creates a logTransfer-object and persists it to the database.
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - is the number to the sending account.
        accountNumber2 - is the number to the receiving account.
        kroner - is the amount of kroner being sent from the one account to the other.
        oere - is the amount of oere being sent from the one account to the other.
        message - is the message/KID associated with the transaction.
        Returns:
        boolean
